title: 6 of the best toffee-apple flavoured treats, tried and tasted
text:
The idea of a crisp Granny Smith or Braeburn apple dunked in caramelised sugar and hardened until brittle (flavoured with vanilla bean paste and ground cinnamon perhaps, or finished with fennel seeds, a sprinkle of sea salt flakes, or sesame seeds), may well induce nostalgia for childhood autumnal evenings.

Or perhaps the thought of the sweet treat – traditionally eaten on Bonfire Night and associated, too, with Hallowe’en, coinciding with the apple harvest – is enough to give you toothache.

Shop-bought versions invariably disappoint: the fresher the fruit and the sooner the caramel has cooled, the better. But for those who don’t fancy the faff of boiling sugar and water to make their own, there’s...
